name: Chrysanthemum Bloom - Medium 4x4"
description:
With such amazing detail, add a splash of colour with your favourite frits to make this design truly stand out! This stunning chrysanthemum flower is ideal for your coasters, dishes, platters, or to combine with other decals to make a scene!

4x4" in size

Available in Black or White, High-Fire (1400ºF) or Low-Fire (1100ºF). The High-Fire version is ideal for firing onto freshly cold-worked glass that needs a bit of fire-polishing in the kiln at the same time, while the Low-Fire version is great for pieces where you want to avoid any slumping or sagging while firing the decal.

Instructions are included in the package, and available on the Glass Fusing Decals website. www.glassfusingdecals.com

Ships through regular mail in a lovely little package so it arrives at your door safe and sound.

All designs are copyright Michelle Prosek 2013.

name: Inukshuk
description:
An inukshuk is a stone landmark or cairn built by humans, used by the Inuit, Inupiat, Kalaallit, Yupik, and other peoples of the Arctic region of North America. The inukshuk may have been used for navigation, as a point of reference, a marker for travel routes, fishing places, camps, hunting grounds, places of veneration, drift fences used in hunting or as a food cache. A beautiful design, with a great history! Fantastic to use alone on pendants and other small work, or with other designs to create a scene! 

.75x1" in size

Available in Black or White, High-Fire (1400ºF) or Low-Fire (1100ºF). The High-Fire version is ideal for firing onto freshly cold-worked glass that needs a bit of fire-polishing in the kiln at the same time, while the Low-Fire version is great for pieces where you want to avoid any slumping or sagging while firing the decal.

Instructions are included in the package, and available on the Glass Fusing Decals website. www.glassfusingdecals.com

Ships through regular mail in a lovely little package so it arrives at your door safe and sound.

All designs are copyright Michelle Prosek 2012.
